pros: Chrome plated push-up bars won't rust
Foam coverings along top to stop slips
Rubber covering on bottom to keep bars in place
Can accommodate weigh up to 325 pounds
Designed to work on any floor surface
cons: Heavier athletes report that this bar is too flimsy for their size

customer_reviews.title: A little cheap but OK enough
customer_reviews.text: I don't recall if it was a special deal but I have seen that the price of these has gone up since I purchsed them at $5.00. My 4-star rating is based on that purchase price, otherwise I would probably reduce it by one star. The quality of the construction is just OK. The metal tubing is fine quality but the plastic wing nuts seem to get a little loose over time. The bumpers that rest on the floor are a pretty hard plastic and tend to slip a little bit on hard surfaces. Had they used rubber or silicone that would have been a better solution.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Pushups
customer_reviews.text: I picked these up when I started doing P90x and it was suggested, so I figured why not. I'm also getting older and have an office job, so my wrists are getting worse from sitting at a computer most of the time. The bars allow my wrists to stay straight, sure is a big difference when you swap back and forth. Very noticeable the strain push ups put on your wrists, I am very glad I have these. These are pretty good, but the knob used to put these together comes loose slowly. The foam wrap also slides around a little, but easy enough to put back in place. I will definitely use these for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Saint

customer_reviews.title: Light but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Really liking what I have been getting form CAP lately. These are quick to put together, a nice height, soft hand grips, and the bottom grips gran the rug nicely. Pushups, reverse pushups, inverse pushups, other variations, and dips (when seated on floor, not elevated) all get done with comfort and effectiveness. They are a bit higher than the ones I would use at the gym, and I am mindful to not lower myself too much, but its's not really an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D.

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: Not a big fan. The base is too small. They tip over when doing wide push-ups. But the deal-breaker is that the foam grips roll and move. Not a good thing when you are trying to workout. My suggestion? Don't skimp out on push up bars.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Topcad

customer_reviews.title: Good functionality. Rubber grip is too thin.
customer_reviews.text: These bars are excellent for pushups. They really take the pressure off my wrists. The price I got them for was really good. The only negative is that the rubber on the handles moves around, and does not provide any padding for my hands. I’ve started wearing gel workout gloves when using these handles to get extra padding.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy pushup bars
customer_reviews.text: Solid build, doesnt hurt hands during long sets. I use these on hardwood floors and they dont slip unless i use really bad form and even then they only move a small amount. Can really feel a difference when doing pushups. Really helps eleviate wrist pain when doing long sets. Also really like the ability to move these into different positions to work different muscle areas.
customer_reviews.author: It-is-wut-it-is

customer_reviews.title: Handle padding ripped after two uses
customer_reviews.text: In addition to braces/supports, I bought these bars to modify exercises that involve weight-bearing on flexed wrists. Unfortunately, the padding on the handles slips around quite a bit and one of the sides ripped during its second use. Haven't decided if I'll try to repair the padding with duct tape or return them.
customer_reviews.author: CJC

customer_reviews.title: Push up bar, are they worth it?
customer_reviews.text: These are great for working out, they are strong, easy to setup and have great support. I workout on a hard wood floor, the rubber finish helps avoild sliding or slipping. I have used other push up bars that costed more and by far these are the best i have. Lets see how long they last, for now am hapoy with them
customer_reviews.author: Sonu

customer_reviews.title: These are good, just okay though
customer_reviews.text: These are good, just okay though. It is not really possible to apply pressure to them as in a downward dog because they slide on both carpeted and wood floors. If you have a padded fitness mat then they should be okay, but for people hoping to do yoga these are only really good for being directly on top when doing certain kinds of pushups. Any lateral pressure will make them slide. If you are looking to use these for yoga, you would do better to look at a product that specifically has anti-skid features as a part of its design.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Lane

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the plastic version
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the plastic ones. These don't flex when I do push-ups. This coming from a 235lb guy. I gave their plastic version To my wife
customer_reviews.author: Razeel211

customer_reviews.title: NEED MORE PADDING !
customer_reviews.text: NICE PRODUCT ! But when your are doing more than 10 push-ups the padding sucks. IF IT HAD BETTER PADDING. this would be a 10 start product!
customer_reviews.author: Hollywood Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: Great addon to my home gym
customer_reviews.text: I do 100 or so pushups/day. I have tried perfect pushups before, however, I wanted something more sturdy and elevated. This equipment enhances the pushups a great deal. Due to slightly higher elevation, the range of movement is also more effective.
customer_reviews.author: gaurav singh

customer_reviews.title: Push it real good!
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a fine product, as advertised. A good value and you can get a lot of good use out of these. It would be nice if the padding was a little bigger better and more comfortable. I used a rubber pipe wrap to increase the cushion. No complaints otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic tightening nut breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: the plastic part that tightens the bar into the "foot" broke after only a few uses. disappointing, now the handle wobbles when used, making it worthless
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Deeper Pushups/Easy on Wrists
customer_reviews.text: Having these has changed my life. I never realized how perfect the pushup is for upper body strength until I got these. PROS 1) You can go deeper in your pushup than if you were hands on the floor. 2) Because of the angle of your grip, it is much easier on your wrists than traditional floor pushups. This allows me to do many more than I normally would have with floor pushups. I know bang out about 300 or more every other day (not consecutively, though--I'm not that strong). 3) Foam grips have lasted a long time--no deterioration. CONS 1) All these pushups have made me far too hot. It's a real problem.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Good, but foam cover is too thin - palms hurt after a while.
customer_reviews.text: There are good. They are not too heavy. Each bar comes in two parts, the top U bar and two feet bars. The feet are inserted into the U bar and you use your hands to tighten a little T shaped bolt to hold the pieces together. I have to deduct one star because the foam covers are very thin and can make it painful on the palms to press down on them. If I hold them such that my weight is being put on the bones at the bottom part of my palm, that place starts hurting after enough pushups. I really wish the foam were thicker and more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Wonderbread

customer_reviews.title: They don't look sturdy...
customer_reviews.text: ...but they really are! I'm about 220 and am surprised at how well these are holding up. I can remove the pillow now that I'm sure I won't faceplant to the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey N.

customer_reviews.title: I love them. Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I love them. Good quality, solid built, perfect size - large and good height off the ground. These are not some soft aluminum bendable, breakable bars that you could barely hold. These are big, solid construction. I am 214 lbs and use them with no problem. I truly love that they are so large that I am confident my wrist is not gonna break or something. I tried other brands before, but this is my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and stable.  works well.
customer_reviews.text: the assembly of these looks a little off-putting but they work quite well. i'm 175lbs and have done countless pushups with them. easily stored away, too. i've only used them on carpet so i don't know how they'd do on a hard floor but they don't slide around.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Good grip, takes stress off wrists
customer_reviews.text: I have some arthritis in my wrists and fingers so I can't really do push ups with good form anymore without something like this. It allows for an easy grip for varied muscle focus, is easy to assemble/disassemble, good traction/grip against the floor and well priced for how long I expect them to endure. I'm not sure if it was intentionally designed to be portable/travel capable, between this and my TRX straps, I have a full gym literally anywhere I am. Try it out, chances are you'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: hiroze

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5
customer_reviews.text: More Stable would give 4.5... Range is good but the Grip Move after a while, so you have to put it back ... Would Still Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jean Sebastien Zankel

customer_reviews.title: Light-Weight Push Up Bars
customer_reviews.text: These are light-weight Push Up Bars. I personally prefer the rotating perfect push-up-style push-up assisters. However, for this I was just looking for bars that would let me do push-ups without touching the floor. These do that. They are adequately strong to support my 220 pound frame without difficulty. The padding on the handle is comfortable. The height is just right to allow a very full range pushup (much better than hands of floor). These are light enough that I can drop them in a backpack for easy and light portability.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob and Kiki HantlaTop Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Good Pushup Bars.
customer_reviews.text: I've used my CAP pushup bars a couple times now, and they do the job well. I get a deep range of motion and they are secure and well made. They do the simple job they're designed to do, without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: W. COOl

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for Its price
customer_reviews.text: The product looks OK and serves the purpose I bought it. It was easy to put together and quite sturdy. The height is a quarter inch higher than my old one. It allows me to to the pushing up with wider range. It however, still have the traditional plastic "shoes". It works well on carpet but not so much on the bathroom tiles. I wish to have better friction.
customer_reviews.author: TY

customer_reviews.title: ... bigger than I thought they would be but they're awesome. Very durable
customer_reviews.text: They're bigger than I thought they would be but they're awesome. Very durable, great quality. Simple, great to have.
customer_reviews.author: Armando Bravo

customer_reviews.title: For the price- they are a good workout tool
customer_reviews.text: For the price- they are a good workout tool. They help take the strain off your wrists being put in such an awkward position for so long and help with range of motion. The plastic feet tend to slide a bit underneath the weight on some surfaces. More so it other placements trying to workout different muscles. It may make sense to put some two sided tape on the bottom of the feet just to make sure they don't move out from under you and cause injury. After purchasing these I bought the Power Press Push Up trainer board- and I find I use that FAR more often than these bars. That being said- these bars get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: R. Guinn

customer_reviews.title: A step up for push ups...
customer_reviews.text: First time I buy anything like this, I come from regular push ups on the floor.. this gives me room for a better stretch in the pecs and overall better form when doing push ups... construction looks durable, I've used them for a couple of months, no signs of damage or age in any way. If you're looking to improve your overall chest doing body weight exercises like push ups, this will help you a TON without spending much money.. (I would recommend doing some dips too, always leaning forward so you focus more on the pecs and less on tri's and delts)
customer_reviews.author: Elliott Moncayo C.

customer_reviews.title: they look great. But they are very dependable
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a few push up bars. None of them stand up to this set. Yes, they look great. But they are very dependable. I've owned some in the past that would bend when pushing up. Some would bend just from a little bit of weight being applied. One of the worst I've had would slip/move during a set of push ups. Not only do these NOT bend, they do NOT move! Safety is very important when exercising. These are very safe to use. I've also found that different bars are different heights. I find that the height on these is just right. I'd strongly recommend this set.
customer_reviews.author: E Moran

customer_reviews.title: They work.
customer_reviews.text: I like the full range of motion I get. They are solid though I don’t know if the foam will last that long. The bottom is not rubber. It’s plastic. There is always a chance it will slip. Otherwise, a great and important piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Demetrios

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Metal with rubber end caps for stability and good hand grips Takes pressure off wrists and lets me do a lot more push ups at different degrees of separation than I would be able to do otherwise - and you dip lower so its also better range of muscle motion
customer_reviews.author: Keith C.

customer_reviews.title: They are good enough for the intended purpose.
customer_reviews.text: These push up bars are good enough. They're sufficiently strong for at least sub-two-hundred pounders. The one thing that would have gotten them 5 stars for me would have been more padding. The bars put your wrists in a better position for pushups. I am becoming arthritic and putting my palms on the floor is uncomfortable. I prefer not to have my hands cocked backwards 90 degrees to by forearm/wrists. Also I prefer NOT to put my hands on dirty floor. These aren't sanitary of course but I feel better about using them. They also allow a deeper "dive" into the pushup for greater extension of shoulder/chest muscles. As push up bars go these are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: great pair of bars. easy assembly, like in under 2 minutes. i got these for "standing up" push ups against the wall or doorway. these are sturdy! nice rubber grip, too. they are also rigid once assembled, but i am only using them vertically to strengthen my upper arms and pectorals. to be honest, i have rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, fibromyalgia, and sciatica. i am liking these because i can control how much pressure is put on my joints using them vertically---horizontal workout is not a concern right now :-) any way i recommend these for women, and they also make for great free-weights by themselves for stretching and toning. i guess they're abut 3 pounds each.
customer_reviews.author: MsHunnyBrownTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: A Great Addition For Home Workouts
customer_reviews.text: Unless you have weak wrists, you cannot go wrong with these push up bars. Some have complained that the foam padding can slide, but if that is the case your hand placement is likely wrong. I have never had any issues with sliding and if ever felt unstable I merely firmed up my grip and there were never any issues. Push up bars help your range of motion when doing push ups and can also be helpful for beginners who do not understand the depth with which one is supposed to complete the push up motion. These were a great addition for me to my workouts and I have noticed better form because of them.
customer_reviews.author: MSU_Mario

customer_reviews.title: Do the Trick
customer_reviews.text: Not high tech here, but does not have to be. I find these bars to be stable and secure. I have tightened the wing nuts just a bit since first assembling them. No big deal. They CLEARLY transform your pushup routine. The wider range of motion really tweaks your muscles and reults in a much more produtive routine. Some reviewers said that they slip on bare floors. I cannot speak to that since I use them exclusively on carpet. Grips are comfy. At this price, how can you go wrong? If you are working out in such a beastly manner that you tear these up, pat yourself on the back and buy a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Heartbreak Motor Oil

customer_reviews.title: 6 years and counting
customer_reviews.text: Have had these almost 6 years and they still see regular use. Hand grips are comfortable, only problem is they can be slippery on hard wood floors so I always make sure to use them on carpet
customer_reviews.author: CHarp

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant in getting these because they were pretty cheap(price wise) but then i went ahead with it and at first they do feel a little flimsy but once you start using them you realize they're not going anywhere.. They stay firmly in place and there are no issues with them wobbling or feeling like they might break, i weigh 200+ lbs and they stay firm and have not failed me yet.. Great buy especially for the price. They haven't disapointed me and im sure they'll work for anyone else too
customer_reviews.author: S.Khan

customer_reviews.title: WORK GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Well does not matter what bars you use just USE BARS I have been doing push ups on and off for 30 yrs. Then I purchased these bars and what a frkn difference they make. ANY ONE NOT USING BARS IS MISSING 50% of the exercise. GET BARS
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: In less than two weeks one of the foam grips split and is falling off. Kind of useless without the grips. Is it that hard to use foam grips with a little higher quality?
customer_reviews.author: Bill Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Wrists, Get These!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I am 6'2" and 195 pounds. Do push ups regularly on these and they hold up just fine. Over time the grip does tend to slide along the chrome. However, easy fix is to rotate the barbell 180 degrees and "work it" back the way it came. Does not slip at all during the work outs so far. It has been a great way to relieve pressure off of my wrists when doing a variety of push ups.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Courter

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: eliminates that nasty bone grind on the wrist from flat surface push ups and allows you to dip deeper and more comfortably, so you can still inhale all the floor germs you love.
customer_reviews.author: James Killinger

customer_reviews.title: Improved Range of motion, more gains.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to add to my workout regiment. Love the extra range of motion for doing push ups. Also use these with my P90X workout DVD's. Great add to use. Never used bars before now so didn't really know what to think. But after using them I felt the range of motion and a deeper burn. Plus it didn't put any unnecessary strain on my wrists. Durable for me (275 pounds) to use 3 times a week. Have had them for around a month so they are keeping up with me.
customer_reviews.author: Tim R.

customer_reviews.title: Not that good.  There are better ones out there with more padding
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace some Nike push up bars I had purchased many years ago. Right off the bat, I noticed the padding where the hand grips is almost not existent. They started bothering my hand some, especially the more you do. I ended up purchasing the Perfect V2 Pushup Bar from amazon to replace these. I was able to do straight pushups with those too and they feel way better on my hands. I do 4 sets of 50 pushups ever week day. I should have read the reviews more in depth before making my purchase on amazon. I don't recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Paesano

customer_reviews.title: great piece
customer_reviews.text: they are made in metal with cover plastic and great to handre. I do 10 to 20 pushups and them I hold my arms stand in a prank position.It's great for abs
customer_reviews.author: Fabio

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I'm big into the P-90X home workout series and these push-up bars fit in nicely with my routine. Very inexpensive and very easy to assemble. From opening the box to ready-for-use in under a minute total time-elapsed. I've used them on wood floors as well as carpeting and the non-stick padding on the bottom works great. No problems there. Also, I weigh 200 lbs and they showed no signs of bending whatsoever. The only reason I didn't give these bars five stars was the height. I'd prefer they be just a smidgen taller than they actually are but that's just me. I can still do pike-presses with no limitation however.
customer_reviews.author: David LaBourde

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and effective
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Owned a pair back in 2015 but lost em upon moving. Got em again cuz all the gyms closed. Allows to get that "deep" pushup.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: These push-up bars don't yell at me
customer_reviews.text: I'm 64 and working on reestablishing my conditioning without bankrupting my Medicare budget. These push-up bars fit in nicely. I chose them in preference to very similar plastic bars, for the sake of sturdier construction. They assemble easily and quickly, are in fact very sturdy, have useful nonslip surfaces, and perform about as well as push-up bars should perform. They definitely make doing this exercise more useful than the way I learned it in he 60's, which didn't involve bars but did involve a coach yelling at me. These bars don't yell at me. They just make doing he exercise intrinsically more attractive.
customer_reviews.author: R.E. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy/Quality Standard Push-up Bars
customer_reviews.text: These help give you a better range of motion for your push-ups. In addition, they also help you if you work out using a weight vest. I love using these things. They feel sturdy and well-made. I will have to see how well they hold up long term, especially while using the weight best, but I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Devreser

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for under $10 and there's really nothing at all wrong with it. Quality-enough construction and at 180 lbs, I can't see them ever wearing out or breaking. Just keep in mind that the handle screws into the foot portion, being actually two separate pieces. The product is really just made of a hollow pipe/rod probably a millimeter thick that is bent around into the shape you see, which is why its so inexpensive. ...Literally just a bent pipe with a cushioned hand grips, plastic feet to keep it from slipping, and screws to attach the feet portion to the handles.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: great for the price
customer_reviews.text: The push up bars are easy to assemble, and the metal seems pretty sturdy. I have two complaints though: 1) A sturdier base would have been nice. When I try to do ulta-wide pushups, the bars tip over too easily. 2) the padding on the bars was loose, which means the padding would move under my hand when i was using the bars. That seemed dangerous. It was an easy fix though; I just super glued the padding so it wouldn't move. The push up bars aren't perfect, but they're really quite good. My complaints are pretty minor. For the price, you really can't beat these. Definitely better than the many other plastic bars on the market.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for- Its probably worth 5-7$ not 15-20$... came without hardware.. super cheap product--hope it doesn't break after a few hundred pushups..
customer_reviews.author: Lindzi-William

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable for the hands
customer_reviews.text: The small diameter handle digs into the palms and becomes painful if you do a lot of sets. I can see why the very popular Perfect Pushup series of push up handles are made with a large diameter handle. However, the Perfect Basic Pushup has an angular handle that is also painful on the hands. The Perfect Pushup Elite with the good handles go for about $30. I bought a pair of HemingWeighs (I know, corny name but they work great) that are like the Perfect Basic Pushup except they do not have the angular handles and the HemingWeighs were just 16.99.
customer_reviews.author: ordinary bliss

customer_reviews.title: If you have problems with your wrists doing regular push ups, these are the perfect solution.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, incredibly sturdy, and they take the pressure off my wrists so I can continue to work out. I took them to my office job and was working with them when two women who saw me wanted to try them, and they had me order sets for them. My only disappointment is that I didn't order them sooner.
customer_reviews.author: gonzotgreat23

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a weighted vest to add some weight to my pushups, however, the vest would hit the ground before I could perform a full pushup. After purchasing this, I am now able to do a full pushup.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design.
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy. These are held together by two wing nuts; which dont tighten to the point of stability. I didnt buy these to strengthen my wrists.
customer_reviews.author: Fess

customer_reviews.title: I own them all and this is the best
customer_reviews.text: The range of motion and stability is perfect. The ability to tighten the bars is gold - you can do explosive pushups without it dissembling itself mid air.
customer_reviews.author: researchonly

customer_reviews.title: I FEEL RIPPED...
customer_reviews.text: If you do push-ups regularly then this is a MUST buy. It increases the difficulty of the exercise which in turn allows you to build more more muscle. For me it makes procedure of doing hundreds of push-ups less monotone. The intensity increases once you do variations of push-ups (inclined, declined, weights on back). I saw Floyd Mayweather using a similar product in his training for the Guerrero fight and you know the result of that fight! Small footprint which allows for carry on business trips (easy way to knock out 100 pushups before breakfast). A bit too soon see any dramatic effects in chest size, but my arms definitely look larger than before :)
customer_reviews.author: MacHunt

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: You can't get a real linear chest workout from standard push ups. This tool allows you to reach 100% range of motion from arm to chest attachment. It doesn't get any better than this. The product allows constant switch up on positioning with variation. It is sturdy and doesn't slide on carpet, tile, or hardwood (I've checked). Foam is great for grip and comfortable, although I would recommend wiping hands off before gripping so to extend the life of the foam (It will eventually slowly deteriorate if you grip sweaty). Easy dissembling, just four screws that have finger friendly grips. A must have for any chest workout, period.
customer_reviews.author: OneAboveAll

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I thought 253 lbs would not be supported but I was proven wrong! Nice product! Excellent for the cleaveage I’m looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Inez Layman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome push up bars!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent push up bars! Still use it after six years! The assembly is quick. The product is sturdy. However, the grips are slowly being worn out. Then again, I had it for six years so...it is really great. The only issue is that you really have to push yourself to do the push-ups! > _ <
customer_reviews.author: P. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Bars, and they Hurt my Hands.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with these. The material the bars are made with is a very flimsy metal material. The bottom stands of the bars also connect to the arched part with a flimsy wing nut screw. These screws seem to constantly become loose for me, and I often have to re-tighten them quite frequently. What I dislike most about these bars though is that they hurt my hands very bad when using. The foam padding is very thin to the point it really has no effect at all. The bars just dig into my hands worse then using a raw metal dumbbell would.
customer_reviews.author: Frank D.

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a basic set of push-up bars then these will most certainty do the trick. Arrived on time and took all of two minutes to set-up. Been using them everyday now and i havent had a issue yet. You can also do more then push ups with these so dont get hung up on the single use of this item. You wont find a better set for the price. Just make sure all your screws and bolts are tightened and they will last you a life time.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price but I outgrew them easily. I use them for p90x type workouts and some of the moves will cause the bars to topple over, they just aren't stable. A round base would have been idea. My second complaint is the thin foam cushioning. It's just not thick enough to provide comfort, after only a few reps your palms start to hurt. All in all decent product with some comfort issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Push ups hurt again. Thank you.
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea how effective simply giving yourself more room to come down without hitting the ground was gonna be. These simple little things are awesome, comfortable and very light. The worked now hits the insides of the pectorals as well as the middle and outer parts like before. Step up your game, and give 'em a try.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Feeney

customer_reviews.title: Stable
customer_reviews.text: Love this push up bar! I was getting wrist issues without the push up bar. Much better than a previous one I had. I use it for regular, wide, military, and decline push ups. 4 week update: still stable, no issues, works great for all push up variations!
customer_reviews.author: Nazim A.

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: Push up handles. Work well. After a lot of push ups, my hands hurt because the foam just isn't that thick. Still much better than doing push ups on the ground. They'll last forever, except the foam on the handles, which honestly should just be replaced anyway. I got them as a $5 add-on, so absolutely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me - Getting one more.
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit concerned whether the screws and joints would have a little give, which can be disastrous for a push up bar. However my doubts were unfounded. The push up bars work nicely and have no give. I'm 220 pounds, and have no complaints with the bars over the 3 weeks, I've been using them. I just hope the foam grip cushions last the test of time. I've been using them on a carpeted floor, so I've not been able to test the stability on a smooth surface. Getting one more for my office room.
customer_reviews.author: Ac

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality product. The welds holding the metal pieces together are tiny. I have used twice and its already loose. Now im afraid that i am going to fall on my face if i keep using. Called the manufacturer but their voicemail is full.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal for the price! (add-on)
customer_reviews.text: For $5 as an add-on item, these are way sturdier and higher quality than expected. They grip decently well on wood floor, and they are made of metal, not plastic, so it feels strong and durable. The handle grip could be slightly more comfortable, but it's better than my perfect pushup handles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bang for your Buck
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly, solid sturdy construction, lightweight, and comfortable foam make this a great addition to your workout routine. Compared to regular pushups these help alleviate the pressure on your wrists that will pay off in the long term.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel

customer_reviews.title: Why not
customer_reviews.text: This year was lost to politicians and lame Mayors. These handles are suitable for all levels home use.
customer_reviews.author: darin

customer_reviews.title: growing my triceps and biceps
customer_reviews.text: I could never do a push up. I decided to try these push up bars. At first I started with 5, in about a week of doing them I can now do 12 and I am pushing them farther out in front of me so I can really feel the abs work. I recommend this to anyone but for women who want to shape their arms and gain strength these are for you. I am so glad I got them.
customer_reviews.author: Ladydi

customer_reviews.title: For sure!!!
customer_reviews.text: I read all the other lesser rated reviews. I have to assume they must have heard you, orrrrrrr, you got the wrong P/U bars. The set i just received is WELL Constructed, all 4 assembly screws fit perfectly & have wide heads to assure they are fastened tightly. I have used them twice daily for past 3 days. The rubber foot grips hold great on bare floor or carpet. The hand grips could be a SHADE / TAD thicker, but not MUCH more, or they would cause decrease in the usefulness of he product.
customer_reviews.author: Luvalo

customer_reviews.title: Feels a bit off
customer_reviews.text: Marked up: useful, doing the job, price. Marked down: doesn't feel stable, handles not support high wight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I think they're definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to find better ways to do pushups simply because I have issues with my shoulders, but I find that push-ups are one exercise that makes s profound difference in my exercise routine. Although I don't always use them, I have found these bars helpful so that it puts a little less stress on my wrists and shoulders and I can try to focus more on my pecs and triceps, which is really where I'm trying to put my emphasis anyway. They're relatively inexpensive, and I think definitely worth the money, even if you don't always use them for your staple push-up.
customer_reviews.author: Billychic

customer_reviews.title: ... just about every other day and they are a good, basic push up bar
customer_reviews.text: I use these just about every other day and they are a good, basic push up bar. Assembly was easy, took seconds. They feel durable and are a good quality. I feel safe using them and would recommend to anyone looking for a set.
customer_reviews.author: puzzler

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy product! Great price!!
customer_reviews.text: These came in 3 pieces per side. Super simple to put together. Once together they are extremely sturdy. My husband and I both agree the padding could be a bit thicker, but it is still sufficient. I have been using them during Insanity, for most of the floor work. I have found it helpful combined with wrist support. I would definitely suggest these for anyone struggling with the strain of push ups or who want to get deeper in their push up.
customer_reviews.author: janesaid2

customer_reviews.title: Parallets
customer_reviews.text: Works just like you would buy from your local sports shop before they sold out due to the pandemic. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cheap and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: affordable push-up bars that are easy to put together and sturdy. these bars help you get better range and stability when doing your pushups. also, it's better on your wrists because they're not bent and bearing all that weight. some might say you can do the same thing with dumbbells, but unless you have really big weights, you don't get as much height. also, not everybody has dumbbells. in my opinion, these are cheap enough and useful enough to warrant the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: wartleby

customer_reviews.title: there may be better, but this works
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 290 with no strength. Couldn't do 5 regular pushups prior to getting these a couple months ago. Now I don't use these anymore and it's actually now easier to do regular pushups. I can do 25 straight on my own now. So they served their purpose. Only reason I give 4 stars is because I had to tighten them up with each use. But I'd recommend this to anyone looking to build muscle but struggles with pushups.
customer_reviews.author: OG Ro

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and great quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent construction and grip cushions. Good strong and sturdy push up handles.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Juan Perez

customer_reviews.title: Nice Push Up Bar!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding! I have had for a few weeks and use them every other day, along with my 13 year old son, who wants to get stronger for basketball. We definitely see some growth. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, sturdy enough, great for targeting specific muscles!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, light, comfortable, and absolutely great for varying your pushups. I got these because my wrists tend to hurt in normal pushup position, the loaded while flat on the floor position. Beyond that, I also had wrist surgery recently and now especially can't do regular pushups right now. Hammer position works well for me. These allow me to perform pushups comfortably, as well as to target all kinds of arm, shoulder, and chest muscles by positioning them differently. HIGHLY recommend them for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Otto

customer_reviews.title: I Really Like These!
customer_reviews.text: These Push Up Bars are light weight but sturdy! They are easy to assemble right out of the box....just screw the feet into the stem with the wing-nuts provided. The rubber feet on the bottom are excellent for gripping any surface without slipping around. My only gripe is the handle foam is light weight and compresses quickly. You pretty much feel the metal bar drilling into your hand after a while. If they could beef up that handle with some thick dense foam then these would be unstoppable.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Solid equipment
customer_reviews.text: So far the equipment works and feels well. Lower profile than pictures seem to show but higher than the last bars I bought on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: JP Amznfan

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly what you need
customer_reviews.text: I really have come to love cap barbell. Time in and time out they deliver excellent products at a low cost. These handles are perfect for pushups they fit your hand comfortably and are the right height you don't need anything more than these.
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: Good addition
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my home gym. I had been using large dumbbells as push up bars. It worked, but I like the bars better. These are stable; I am close to 300 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Proper Wrist Alignment
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for those needing extra wrist support these are lightweight and do a great job.
customer_reviews.author: this game is top notch.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Do my weighted dips with these bad boys. Should have done this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Melendez

customer_reviews.title: 300+ pounds still good to go!
customer_reviews.text: If you weigh 300+, this is it right here! Strong and sturdy! Eventually if you use it everyday you won't need to worry about your weight😉.
customer_reviews.author: Chewy

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Love how light weight they are but how good they hold weight.
customer_reviews.author: BFL2134

customer_reviews.title: Definity
customer_reviews.text: Bought it because of the high reviews. I purchased this set because I was experiencing some discomfort in my wrist. I received them and was impressed of quality for a small price. The product is sturdy but caused my arm to hurt because of the height of the bar from the floor. I am 43 yrs old and that might have something to do with it too. Definitely feel the workout and would recommend for strength training.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great product: solid lightweight handles with a bit of ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product: solid lightweight handles with a bit of padding on top. The padding isn't enough to protect hands from hurting, so I recommend a good pair of gloves if you're going to be using this consistently.
customer_reviews.author: TINA

customer_reviews.title: Does its job!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two sets of these for my fiance and I to use for P90X. We were finding that our wrists were hurting and hoped these would help with that - and they did! The side might wobble a bit, but a turn of the tightening knob fixes that right up. For being less than $10 I find these to be a great deal. Might not withstand heavy daily use, but ours are still like new after 1-2 times a week use for 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Brigitte H

customer_reviews.title: Good looking cheap set of push up grips.
customer_reviews.text: These are plastic, now with that being said.. They are durable and they look great. Price is cheaper than many lesser quality sets at around $10-12? You get a deeper push up, working the chest with this.
customer_reviews.author: jack

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: These have worked as advertised for a couple years now. Havent had any durability issues, I typically use them once to three times per week and am only doing 50 reps so I cant speak to how theyd stand up to heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: A. Moore

customer_reviews.title: They are okay
customer_reviews.text: Puts you a decent bit off the ground. They are kind of clunky.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Good value, good product
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it is intended to do. Provides great support and an excellent compliment to a workout. My one drawback is that the pads for the grip are a little thin and feel flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Ckenn3

customer_reviews.title: STURDY
customer_reviews.text: Easy and quick to assemble and so far hasn't broken on me. Will see.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I think they are great went together easy and feel sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J

customer_reviews.title: Fits the bill.
customer_reviews.text: I read a few of the reviews on this item, and some on some higher priced similar items. I love them. I do a few hundred pushups a week, have had no problems now and I purchases these several months ago. I weigh about 220 lbs, and I am about 5'11''. They consistently offer me the stability I need, while allowing me to get a deeper stroke on my pushups. I use them for standard, declined, wide and military style pushups.
customer_reviews.author: Billy J. Golden

product_meta.title: CAP Barbell Pair of Push Up Bars
feature_bullets: One pair of high-quality, chrome plated push up holders
Slip-resistant foam covered handles for comfort
Push ups target your chest, shoulder, and back muscles
Designed to improve your positioning for pushups
